column4: Hello! - Ubuntu hate i810 vid - (Good Excuse to ditch the old mobo eh?)
Who is the best retailer to buy motherboards from?
i can give u lists of new boards ive installed and setup with debian as servers and desktops
ahh well for example tyan kw8 works, but isnt all supported yet
not realy, depends wat ur doing
with the amd64 boards u need to get a list of the components and research them, as things like usb work but things like sata and scsi on tyan k8w isnt fully supported yet
asus msi abit are fairly popular
like nforce2 works good tyah tests there boards in linux with there new amd64 nforce3/4 chipset boards, all the nforce stuff seems to have growing support
amd and via chipsets also arent too bad, just dont pick like sis or ali
depends wat ur budget is also msi asus abit is good value tyan is expensive
http://www.tyan.com/products/html/athlon.html the amd-760 chipset has been out a while too
if u get the latest kernel for 2.6.x u can see wat drivers and support is in there
nah they make a board  at about $800 is the k8e or k8w my cuzin runs a server
search around on google theres heaps of stuff, if ur going to use stuff like sata make sure theres support for that chipset and drivers and patches before u get a board
obviously u pay more for tyan but the features and power does outweigh the others
if ur to get an nforce based chipset board, then get the nforce4 ultra not just nforce4 http://www.msicomputer.com/product/p_list.asp?class=mb&cpu=3
